name: Crystal Peak Lodge

reviews.title: WHAT A DEAL!!!
reviews.text: Our family of 13- children, grandchildren- were so impressed by the top of the line quarters.

We shared a 4 bedroom, 4 bath suite with sub zero appliances, a wine cooler, plenty of dishes and flatware, beautiful views of the still snow covered peaks. The dining table seats 8 comfortably; beds and pillows were great. Negatives- not enough soap in the bathroom. Remedied very quickly when mentioned. All this for a bargain price too low to believe!
reviews.title: If staying on the Mountain this is a GREAT place!

reviews.text: We stayed in unit #7500 at Crystal Peak Lodge. It is a three bedroom and the only way to be closer to ski in, ski out would be if the lift was in the building. The decor in the unit was very tastefully done. We would highly recommends this property and this unit.
reviews.title: Stay here only if you like to wake up...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay here only if you like to wake up early because the grooming machines start up at about 5:40am every day. Seems they could groom other areas first.
reviews.title: Awesome Condo-Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: New Condo with nice layout and kitchen and fireplace was a nice touch-didn't work when we first got there and within minutes of our call someone came and fixed it immediately, Cleaning Service on time and always cleaned our dishes, Fitness Room, Hot Tub area, Garage was convenient
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.text: We said this phrase over and over again during our stay in Breckenridge. The Crystal Peak Lodge is a great place to stay. Everything from the location, ski lockers, ski and snow board rentals are perfect. The rooms and the lodge itself are perfect and super clean. They provide room cleaning service daily. The staff was very willing to help in any way. And the undergroung heated parking was a plus (especially with the 18' of snow that we got). The lodge is only down the street. You could either use the shuttle of Crystal Peak Lodge or you can drive. You are also to take the gondola (which is right outside your door) to town during the day if you would like, but the gondola does stop running around 5:00pm. The hot tub and fitness were very clean too. Ther fitness facility consists of a steam room, two tread mills, elipital trainer and two bikes. It also has bumbells up to 50 or 60 pounds and a universal nautilus type machine. And two adjustable benches. It is an adquate facitily to do some cardio and some light wights and abs. We rate Crystal Peak Lodge a perfect 10. We loved it and will go there many more times.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the best ski-in, ski-out locations we've found. The condos are literally twenty yards from the peak 7 lift and the gondola that will take you either to peak 8 or into the town of Breck. The two bedroom unit we stayed in had granite countertops and all GE Profile appliances...all first rate. The units are literally brand new having opened in November '08.
reviews.title: Great Location, watch your altitude.

reviews.text: The units are comfortable, spacious and have views of either the ski slopes or the town and mountains beyond. There are two outdoor hot tubs, but no pool. The heated indoor garage was a nice touch. The staff was helpful and attentive. However, staff training does seem to be an issue as the property is new.
reviews.title: Great Lodge, Great Location at the Base of Peak 7

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just one subject of caution: The property is situated at the base of peak 7 at the exact altitude of 10,000 feet. It's the highest place to stay in Breckenridge. We've skied that high before, but never stayed that high. If you are like us, and live at sea level, you can almost definately expect some symptoms of Acute Mountain Sickness (AMS). Both my wife and I required supplimental oxygen for most of our stay. We are neither old nor frail. We met several others with similar stories. You just have to face the fact that you cannot come from sea level to ten thousand feet in one day and expect to feel perfectly well.
reviews.title: Awesome!!

reviews.text: The hotel staff was clueless as to this problem. We needed a doctor the first night and the person at the front desk suggested we drive into Frisco (about 20 minutes). It's a good thing my wife looked in the phone book and found an altitude specialist who makes 3 am house calls...I kid you not. Dr. Grey!
reviews.title: Best Place In Breckenridge!

reviews.text: My first trip to Colorado was amazing! The Breckenridge location is ideal. This new Lodge has amazing views out every window! Very friendly staff, nice billiard room w/flat screen, hot tub, mini pool, steam room, outdoor grill, outdoor fireplace & fitness center. Our unit had 2 master suites, large kitchen w/granite, s.s. appliances, stone fireplace & 3 flat screens! BEAUTIFUL! Also had heated indoor garage! We are setting up our next trip for the exact same time next year! Weather was good High 60 ish, low 45 ish. Had first snowfall on the snow caps. Very friendly staff! I give it a 9.8 out of 10!!!!! You can not go wrong with this choice in accommodations!!!
reviews.title: Perfect in every way!

reviews.text: These are individually owned, but have alot of the same amenities. New everything! Full kitchens with top of the line appliances. Huge rooms with daily maid service. Hot tubs, fire pit, pool table for the kids. Flat panels with cable in every room, DVD in main room, Fireplace, and balcony.
reviews.title: Awesome new resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only drawback was that restaurant only open on weekends in summer. So I guess we'll have to go back in the winter.
reviews.title: Great location on peak 7 and 8

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 days in August. New codo with very affordale summer prices. Altitude is very high at 9600 feet. Rooms are well decorated and large. Location is next to stops on the city gondola. Right next to peak 7 lift. Beware ,the gondola went right past my living room window and would likely be noisy in the winter. Go for the rooms with numbers 05-10 versus 00-05 because of this. Location is remote with drive to city for anything you need. Sevens restaurant in Grand Lodge next door is fine but mostly empty in the summer. Great happy hour prices with a personal bartender. This is a true ski in ski out location.
reviews.title: A lovely resort in a beautiful town

reviews.text: I met up with a friend I had not seen in almost 25 years, and to celebrate our mutual July birthdays, she treated me to three days at Crystal Peak Lodge. What a beautiful lodge. She booked us a two bedroom condo, and this was five star, deluxe all the way.
reviews.title: HANDS DOWN...THE BEST

description: Located at the base of Peak 7, Crystal Peak Lodge is home to 45 exquisite ski-in/ski-out residences. This coveted location provides exclusive beachfront living, Breck style.
